relation: Great for these types of students
This school is really great for any type of person especially for anyone that likes to have extracurriculum classes and volunteer. You'll love it here once you get here and see how live is here.

Be on time because if you don't then some professors may lock the door on you and some may take points off a test, report, or essay. If you want to drive to school, then make sure you always go the speed limit. Have all work turned in the day it's due or you'll lose some points. Check the calendar-always for days No school or other events.(Don't be like me)

The tuition at the low, if anyone wants to find out how it costs, then go to the college website: www.asun.edu to find out how much it costs and you'll be amazed. They also have Distance Learning classes at a small fee as well. You'll need at least the FAFSA done and 2 or 3 scholarships for a whole year.
I am enjoying being here because the tuition is low, you get to work on additional projects for the college, treated more like an adult, and you don't have to get permission to leave the room-EVER.

I am learning many things like Theatre, Reading, Writing, and Math but I later I am going to learn about Philosophy, Computers, Physical Fitness, and Oral Comminications. Anyone can learn a lot here. The teachers are really cool and easy going-especially for freshman.

Also our cancelor brings food for us to eat and we all talk and play games. We also have fall blast and carnival. We have flag football,softball and little tournaments in basketball.}
